revised_title: Observations on the Variation of the Magnetic Needle at Sea
tldr: This article presents observations made by Mr. David Ross on the variation of the magnetic needle while on board the Montagu Man of War from 1760 to 1762. Ross found that the variation was less at anchor in the West-India Islands than at sea, which led him to question the cause of this phenomenon. The observations were communicated to Mr. William Mountain, F.R.S., who shared them with the Royal Society.
